description.narrative: By 2020, the education system, NGOs and families have increased capacity to provide and facilitate gender-sensitive and inclusive formal, non-formal, informal education opportunities for adolescent boys and girls., which contributes to Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Harmful Practices (Fgm/C And Child Marriage), Learning Outcomes, Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, the education and CP systems, NGOs and communities increasingly provide vulnerable girls and boys with gender-sensitive opportunities to realize their rights

sector.narrative: Education sector planning including coordinating role, SDG 4, etc.
Provision of (formal and non-formal) multiple-levels or alternative pathways of education (including in temporary learning spaces)
Provision of skills development for adolescents (10-19 year-olds) (including in temporary learning spaces)
Social and behaviour change communication for child marriage
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
System strengthening - gender equitable skills development (excluding SRGBV)
System strengthening - gender-responsive teaching and learning (excluding SRGBV)

title.narrative: Turkey United Nations Development Assistance Framework
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
Turkey 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020, the education system, NGOs and families have increased capacity to provide and facilitate gender-sensitive and inclusive formal, non-formal, informal education opportunities for adolescent boys and girls.

description.narrative: The capacity of the education system, NGOs and families to provide gender responsive, inclusive education opportunities for adolescent girls and boys increased, with a special focus on alternative non-formal and informal learning opportunities for out-of-school refugee children and children at risk of dropout. UNICEF continued to provide support to programmes that promote adolescents' retention in school through an inclusive approach. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:15/01/2020

title.narrative: Number of refugee child/adolescent girls and boys with access to non-formal or informal education opportunities
Existence of programmes for adolescent girls and boys to increase retention in upper secondary schools among the most vulnerable students (e.g. CwD, refugee children)

baseline.value: No nationwide programmes in place. An orientation programme to facilitate the transition to 9th grade has been tested, adapted by MoNE and approved for scale-up. An intervention programme aiming to in

target.value: 2020:A programme for adolescent girls and boys aiming to increase attendance rates and prevent early school dropout among the most vulnerable students has been tested and is ready to be implemented nationw

actual.value: 2019:MoNE officially adopted the orientation programme into its annual plans to facilitate the transition to 9th grade and implements in all upper-secondary schools in Turkey.
